Which version of the Eclipse platform are you running?
org.eclipse.jst 1.5.4.v200704150219-kW-NuyxHh4-w7-n and org.eclipse.wst 1.5.4.v200704200440-X3TmzmK-W-vP-Fs.  Let me know if you need more info.

It would help if you could attach the configuration details of your install to this bug (Help->About->Configuration Details).

Does your Eclipse install contain the bundles org.eclipse.platform and org.eclipse.ui.cheatsheets?  Is there anything else in your .log file?

I think I understand what is happening: org.eclipse.ui.cheatsheets is an optional dependency of org.eclipse.platform.  There is an action set declaration in org.eclipse.platform's plugin.xml which references a class in org.eclipse.ui.cheatsheets.  I believe that if the cheatsheets bundle is not available, the error from comment #0 will be written to the log.

Moving to Runtime for comment - is there anything we can do to detect this case so that we don't generate an entry in the error log?
Do you still need the log?
The configuration details file would be helpful to confirm what I think is happening. If there are more entries in your .log, that would be good too.

Let me know if you need anything else.

There goes my theory...

Do you see the exception on every start, or just when starting with a new workspace?
It happens on both scenarios, new workspace and existing workspaces.
Scott, do you see log entry as well?

(In reply to comment #10)
> Scott, do you see log entry as well?
